avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls above the tree line. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible.
The wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads,.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days are to be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment: The wind will transport the loosely bonded old snow. As a consequence of wind from variable directions, further wind slabs will form above approximately 1700 m. The wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack. Weak layers exist in the snowpack. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.

tendency.comment: The meteorological conditions will foster a settling of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.
Small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized natural avalanches are possible. The wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads,.
avalancheActivity.highlights:
The wind slabs represent the main danger.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.

snowpackStructure.comment: Below approximately 1500 m only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of moist loose snow avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on sunny slopes.
